intro: Ruellia caroliniensis var. nanella, commonly known as the small-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
